content.description: Dr. Blankenship is conducting a study on obedience that will take place at a local shopping center. Participants will be asked to complete a survey about their favorite sports teams. Participants will be told that the study is looking at their responses to the survey. However, Dr. Blankenship is actually studying whether the participants will obey when the experimenter tells them they are required to stay in an uncomfortably overheated testing room for 20 minutes after they complete the survey.
content.question: Which of the following ethical considerations applies to this research?

choices.label: Because the study is being conducted at a shopping center, Dr. Blankenship does not need to get informed consent from the participants.
This study would not receive approval during institutional review because obedience research cannot be legally conducted.
Because there is very low risk to the participants in this study, Dr. Blankenship will not need to be concerned about confidentiality of the participantsâ€™ results.
Because the study involves deception, Dr. Blankenship must debrief the participants following the study to inform them about the true purpose of the research.

content.answer: Because the study involves deception, Dr. Blankenship must debrief the participants following the study to inform them about the true purpose of the research.

skill.text: 2.D: Evaluate whether a psychological research scenario followed appropriate ethical procedures.
